InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input dataset.

StringVectorProperty.name: ADummyFileListDomain
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: pv hides the first file list domain.

StringVectorProperty.name: BWDataFile
StringVectorProperty.label: Bandwidth File
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: path to the file conatining bandwidth data

StringVectorProperty.name: TimeDataFile
StringVectorProperty.label: Time Data File
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: path to the file conatining strings to use in place of time step

StringVectorProperty.name: TimeStepFile
StringVectorProperty.label: Time Step File
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: path to the file containing the time step

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQImageGhosts
SourceProxy.label: SQ Image Ghosts

Documentation.long_help: A filter to generate requested ghosts cells for image data.
Documentation.short_help: A filter to generate requested ghosts cells for image data.

SourceProxy.Documentation: A filter to generate requested ghost cells for image data.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Sets the input for the filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: CopyAllArrays
IntVectorProperty.label: Copy all arrays
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Copy all point data, if not set only the selected arrays from the ArraysToCopy list will be coppied.

StringVectorProperty.name: ArraysToCopy
StringVectorProperty.label: Copy selected arrays
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name(s) array(s) to filter.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQTensorGlyph
SourceProxy.label: SQ Tensor Glyphs

Documentation.long_help: This filter generates an ellipsoid, cuboid, cylinder or superquadric glyph at each point of the input data set. The glyphs are oriented and scaled according to eigenvalues and eigenvectors of tensor point data of the input data set.
Documentation.short_help: This filter generates an ellipsoid, cuboid, cylinder or superquadric glyph at each point of the input data set. The glyphs are oriented and scaled according to eigenvalues and eigenvectors of tensor point data of the input data set.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Tensor Glyph filter generates an ellipsoid, cuboid, cylinder or superquadric glyph at every point in the input data set. The glyphs are oriented and scaled according to eigenvalues and eigenvectors of tensor point data of the input data set. The Tensor Glyph filter operates on any type of data set. Its output is polygonal.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Glyph filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputTensors
StringVectorProperty.label: Tensors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the tensor array on which to operate. The indicated array's eigenvalues and eigenvectors are used for scaling and orienting the glyphs.

InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.label: Glyph Type
InputProperty.Documentation: This property determines which type of glyph will be placed at the points in the input dataset.

IntVectorProperty.name: ExtractEigenvalues
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle whether to extract eigenvalues from tensor. If false, eigenvalues/eigenvectors are not extracted and the columns of the tensor are taken as the eigenvectors (the norm of column, always positive, is the eigenvalue). If true, the glyph is scaled and oriented according to eigenvalues and eigenvectors; additionally, eigenvalues are provided as new data array.

IntVectorProperty.name: ColorGlyphs
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines whether or not to color the glyphes.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the scalar array to use for coloring

IntVectorProperty.name: ColorMode
IntVectorProperty.label: Color by
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines whether input scalars or computed eigenvalues at the point should be used to color the glyphs. If ThreeGlyphs is set and the eigenvalues are chosen for coloring then each glyph is colored by the corresponding eigenvalue and if not set the color corresponding to the largest eigenvalue is chosen.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ScaleFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the scale factor to scale every glyph by.

IntVectorProperty.name: LimitScalingByEigenvalues
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines whether scaling of glyphs by ScaleFactor times eigenvalue should be limited. This is useful to prevent uncontrolled scaling near singularities.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaxScaleFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: If scaling by eigenvalues should be limited, this value sets an upper limit for scale factor times eigenvalue.

IntVectorProperty.name: Symmetric
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines whether or not to draw a mirror of each glyph.

IntVectorProperty.name: ThreeGlyphs
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle whether to produce three glyphs, each of which oriented along an eigenvector and scaled according to the corresponding eigenvector.

InputProperty.name: DatasetInput
InputProperty.label: Topograph
InputProperty.Documentation: Dataset containing the topograph.

InputProperty.name: DatasetInput
InputProperty.label: Topograph
InputProperty.Documentation: Dataset containing the topograph.

InputProperty.name: DatasetInput
InputProperty.label: Vector Field
InputProperty.Documentation: Dataset containing the vector field.

InputProperty.name: SeedPointInput
InputProperty.label: Seed Cells
InputProperty.Documentation: Cells to generate seed points from (at cell center).

InputProperty.name: TerminatorInput
InputProperty.label: Terminator Surfaces
InputProperty.Documentation: Surfaces which if present stop field line integration when a field line crosses one.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vector Field
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaxStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Max Step Size
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximum integration step size as a multiple of cell lengths.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaxLineLength
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Max Arc Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximum streamline arc length beyond which line integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: NullThreshold
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Null Threshold
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Vector field magnitude below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MinSegmentLength
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimum Segment Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Lower bound on the segments in the resulting streamline

IntVectorProperty.name: SqueezeColorMap
IntVectorProperty.label: Squeeze Color Map
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Use the minimum number of intersect colors required. Requires global reduction.

IntVectorProperty.name: Mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the mode of operation to one of STREAM,TOPOLOGY,POINCARE.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseDynamicScheduler
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set the work is by a simple self-scheduling algorithm. In this case all of the seed source data has to be duplicated on all processes. This must be off if this is not the case. Set once before the filter runs.

IntVectorProperty.name: MasterBlockSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how much work the master does in between servicing work requests from the workers. Should be much smaller the WorkerBlockSize.

IntVectorProperty.name: WorkerBlockSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how much work is given to the worker processes at each request.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQSurfaceVectors
SourceProxy.label: SQ Surface Vectors
SourceProxy.Documentation: Compute project vector fields onto a surface and surface normal.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQDistributedStreamTracer
SourceProxy.label: SQ-PV-3.6-Stream Tracer

Documentation.long_help: Integrate field lines in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Integrate field lines in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This is the old PV-3.6 stream tracer which doesn't load all data on all processes, but occasionally deadlocks. The Stream Tracer filter generates streamlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. Production of streamlines terminates if a streamline crosses the exterior boundary of the input dataset. Other reasons for termination are listed for the MaximumNumberOfSteps, TerminalSpeed, and MaximumPropagation properties. This filter operates on any type of dataset, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Stream Tracer filter.

InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.label: Seed Type
InputProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines how the seeds for the streamlines will be generated.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: InitialIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Initial Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the initial integration step size as a multiple of cell lengths.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MinimumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the minimum integration step size.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum integration step size.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Steps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum number of steps, beyond which streamline integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumPropagation
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Streamline Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum streamline length (i.e., physical arc length), beyond which line integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQTubeFilter
SourceProxy.label: SQ Tube

Documentation.long_help: Convert lines into tubes. Normals are used to avoid cracks between tube segments.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Tube filter creates tubes around the lines in the input polygonal/unstructured dataset. The output is polygonal.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Tube filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the scalar array on which to operate. The indicated array may be used for scaling the tubes. (See the VaryRadius property.)

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the vector array on which to operate. The indicated array may be used for scaling and/or orienting the tubes. (See the VaryRadius property.)

IntVectorProperty.name: NumberOfSides
IntVectorProperty.label: Number of Sides
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property indicates the number of faces around the circumference of the tube.

IntVectorProperty.name: Capping
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 1, endcaps will be drawn on the tube. Otherwise the ends of the tube will be open.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Radius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property sets the radius of the tube. If the radius is varying (VaryRadius property), then this value is the minimum radius.

IntVectorProperty.name: VaryRadius
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The property determines whether/how to vary the radius of the tube. If varying by scalar (1), the tube radius is based on the point-based scalar values in the dataset. If it is varied by vector, the vector magnitude is used in varying the radius.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: RadiusFactor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: If varying the radius (VaryRadius property), the property sets the maximum tube radius in terms of a multiple of the minimum radius. If not varying the radius, this value has no effect.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseDefaultNormal
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 0, and the input contains no vector array, then default ribbon normals will be generated (DefaultNormal property); if a vector array has been set (SelectInputVectors property), the ribbon normals will be set from the specified array. If this property is set to 1, the default normal (DefaultNormal property) will be used, regardless of whether the SelectInputVectors property has been set.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: DefaultNormal
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the normal to use when the UseDefaultNormal property is set to 1 or the input contains no vector array (SelectInputVectors property).

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQSeedPointLatice
SourceProxy.label: SQ Seed Point Latice
SourceProxy.Documentation: Generates vertices on a latice. The latice can either be unifomrly space or non-linearly stretched independently in each direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: IBounds
DoubleVectorProperty.label: X Range
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the bounds of the seed points.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: JBounds
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Y Range
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the bounds of the seed points.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: KBounds
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Z Range
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the bounds of the seed points.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TransformPower
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Transform Power
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how non-linear the generated points are. 0 is linear.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQRandomCells
SourceProxy.label: SQ Random Cells
SourceProxy.Documentation: Passes randomly selected cells from the input to output.

IntVectorProperty.name: Sample Size
IntVectorProperty.label: Sample Size
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the number of randomly selected cells to pass through to the output.

IntVectorProperty.name: RNGSeed
IntVectorProperty.label: Random Number Generator Seed
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the seed to the random number generator. -1 means to use system time.
